block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM
Mamaroneck ''Free Zone,'' directed by Amos Gitai. Wednesday through April 8. $5 to $8. Emelin Theater, 153 Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

Purchase French Film Festival: ''Les temps qui changent (Changing Times),'' directed by André Techiné; in French with English subtitles. April 1 at 7 p.m. Free. Music Building, Manhattanville College, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5260.

Purchase ''Focus on French Cinema,'' annual French film festival, presented by the Alliance Française of Greenwich, Conn.; screenings of recent French films and discussion sessions with actors and directors. Screenings and information: focusonfrenchcinema.org. Through April 1. $5 to $10 per screening; $20 to $125 for festival passes. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Tarrytown ''Sunrise,'' silent film directed by F. W. Murnau. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $5 to $8. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
FOR CHILDREN

Larchmont ''Leonardo da Vinci,'' family performance by the Traveling Lantern Theater Company. Ages 4 and up. Thursday at 3 p.m. Free; registration required. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.

Mamaroneck ''Seussical,'' musical by Stephen Flaherty and Lynn Ahrens, adapted from the books by Dr. Seuss; presented by Theaterworks USA. April 1 at 1 and 3 p.m. $18. Emelin Theater, 153 Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
New Rochelle Two animated spring films: ''Linnea in Monet's Attic'' and ''It's a Bug's Life.'' Tuesday at 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. Free. New Rochelle Public Library, Lawton Street. (914) 632-7878.

Rye ''Three Centuries of Food,'' vacation mini-camp for children presented by the Rye Historical Society. Ages 7 to 11. Tuesday through Thursday, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. $25 per day; $60 for three days; reservations required. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.

Yonkers ''Mother Goose Time,'' nursery rhymes, stories and songs. Ages 2 to 4. Through May 17. Free; registration required. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will Branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Kingston First Sunday Songwriters Circle: Jack DePietro, Carla Roxman, Karen Whitman and Rick Pantell. April 1 at 2 p.m. $8 and $10. Arts Society of Kingston Arts Center, 97 Broadway. (845) 338-0331.
Middletown Ellis Paul, singer-songwriter. April 1 at 3 p.m. $22 and $25. Morrison Mansion, Orange County Community College. (845) 343-3049.

Tarrytown April Fool's Day concert, with Anthony Laciura, tenor with the Metropolitan Opera; Julie Schmidt, soprano, and others. April 1 at 3 p.m. $20. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.

White Plains ''New Voices'' with Patrick Fitzsimmons, Pat Wictor, Kathleen Pemble and the Brindley Brothers. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $15. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, Extension 223.
White Plains ''Noonday Getaway,'' free concert series: Eun-Ae Lee, pianist; works by Mozart and Prokofiev. Wednesday at 12:10 p.m. Free. Grace Church, 33 Church Street. (914) 949-2478.

Yonkers Trevor Wiggins, director of music at Dartington College of Arts; music from Ghana. Tuesday at 7 p.m. $8 and $10. Birthday concert in honor of David Del Tredici, Pulitzer Prize-winning composer. Wednesday at 7 p.m. $8 and $10. Reisinger Concert Hall, Sarah Lawrence College. (914) 395-2412.
OUTDOORS
Scarsdale ''Spring Family Egg Hunt,'' with chocolate eggs, prizes, the ''Super Bunny'' and a petting zoo. April 7 at 2 p.m. $2 to $7. Greenburgh Nature Center, 99 Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
SPOKEN WORD
Katonah Brenda Hillman, poet. April 1 at 4 p.m. $5. Katonah Village Library, 26 Bedford Road. (914) 232-3508.
White Plains ''Westchester Poetry Slam,'' with Jason Carney, of HBO's Def Poetry. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
THEATER
Armonk ''Laughter on the 23rd Floor,'' staged reading of Neil Simon's comedy by the Armonk Players. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. North Castle Public Library, 19 Whippoorwill Road. (914) 273-3887.

Irvington ''Assassins,'' musical by Stephen Sondheim and John Weidman; presented by the Broadway Training Center of Westchester. Through April 1. $12 to $20. Irvington Town Hall, 85 Main Street. (914) 591-6602.
Nyack Amazing Grace, youth circus; with Dikki Ellis of the Big Apple Circus and others. Through April 1. $8 and $12.50. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Spring Valley ''Hearts and Arrows,'' musical by Phyllis Kirigin, presented by M and M Productions. April 1 at 2 p.m. Free. Finkelstein Memorial Library, 24 Chestnut Street. (845) 352-5700.
Tarrytown ''Evolution of Circus'' by Cirque America. Tuesday at 5 and 8 p.m. $25 to $45. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Armonk ''The Power of Color: The Power of the Brush,'' paintings by Joyce Wenglowski. Through April 15. Lecture by Gillian Greenhill Hannum, professor of art history at Manhattanville College: April 15 at 4 p.m.; $5, reservations required. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.
Beacon ''New Boots and Panties,'' portraits by Kit Keith. Through April 1. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Go North: A Space for Contemporary Art, 469 Main Street.

Beacon ''Models on Main Street,'' photography group show. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Muddy Cup Coffee House, 129 Main Street. (845) 440-8855.
Beacon Mixed-media group show, featuring works by Stevan Jennis, Molly Rausch and Simon Draper. Through Monday. Hours: daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Van Brunt Gallery, 460 Main Street. (845) 838-2995.
Bronx ''Sly,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. $5. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.
Bronx ''The Orchid Show,'' exhibition and sale. Through April 8. $5 to $20. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. Reception: April 15, 1 to 4:30 p.m. $2 to $4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.
Bronxville ''A Celebration of Childhood,'' watercolors by Miriam Schulman. Monday through April 29. Reception: April 29, 1 to 3 p.m. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.
Hudson ''View Three,'' works by three American Indian artists. Through April 7. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, noon to 6 p.m. Nicole Fiacco Gallery, 506 Warren Street. (518) 828-5090.

Katonah ''Tools as Art: The Hechinger Collection,'' curated by Sarah Tanguy. Through April 8. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Mount Vernon ''Overlooked Hero: John Glover and the American Revolution,'' historical documents and prints; continuing. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

New Paltz ''From Impressionist to Modernist: The Paintings of Woodstock Artist Charles Rosen.'' Through May 20. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Samuel Dorsky Museum of Art, SUNY New Paltz. (845) 257-3844.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibition. April 1 through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.
Peekskill ''First Look II,'' mixed media exhibition by art students. Through Sept. 30. $1 and $5. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 11 a.m.
to 6 p.m.; group tours available by appointment. Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art, 1701 Main Street. (914) 788-7166.

Pelham ''Lovely Dark and Deep: Women Artists Retake the Fairy Tale,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.

Port Chester ''East West Fusion,'' recent works by five member artists, with ''Joys of Raku,'' group show. April 1 through 28. Reception: April 1, 3 to 5 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.

Purchase ''New Media: When,'' group show. Through May 20. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. Through June 3. ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. $3 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through June 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.

Tivoli ''The Body Eclectic,'' mixed-media group show. Friday through April 29. Reception: April 7, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.
Valhalla ''Recurrents,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

West Nyack ''A Sequence of Steps,'' photography by Elizabeth Knowles. ''Jiffy Pop,'' mixed-media group show. Both through April 29. Artist panel and cocktail party: April 14 at 8 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockland Center for the Arts, 27 South Greenbush Road. (845) 358-0877.

White Plains ''New Voices'' with Patrick Fitzsimmons, Pat Wictor, Kathleen Pemble and the Brindley Brothers. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $15. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, Extension 223.
White Plains ''Noonday Getaway,'' free concert series: Eun-Ae Lee, pianist; works by Mozart and Prokofiev. Wednesday at 12:10 p.m. Free. Grace Church, 33 Church Street. (914) 949-2478.

Yonkers Trevor Wiggins, director of music at Dartington College of Arts; music from Ghana. Tuesday at 7 p.m. $8 and $10. Birthday concert in honor of David Del Tredici, Pulitzer Prize-winning composer. Wednesday at 7 p.m. $8 and $10. Reisinger Concert Hall, Sarah Lawrence College. (914) 395-2412.

Scarsdale ''Spring Family Egg Hunt,'' with chocolate eggs, prizes, the ''Super Bunny'' and a petting zoo. April 7 at 2 p.m. $2 to $7. Greenburgh Nature Center, 99 Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
SPOKEN WORD
Katonah Brenda Hillman, poet. April 1 at 4 p.m. $5. Katonah Village Library, 26 Bedford Road. (914) 232-3508.
White Plains ''Westchester Poetry Slam,'' with Jason Carney, of HBO's Def Poetry. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
THEATER
Armonk ''Laughter on the 23rd Floor,'' staged reading of Neil Simon's comedy by the Armonk Players. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. North Castle Public Library, 19 Whippoorwill Road. (914) 273-3887.

Irvington ''Assassins,'' musical by Stephen Sondheim and John Weidman; presented by the Broadway Training Center of Westchester. Through April 1. $12 to $20. Irvington Town Hall, 85 Main Street. (914) 591-6602.
Nyack Amazing Grace, youth circus; with Dikki Ellis of the Big Apple Circus and others. Through April 1. $8 and $12.50. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Spring Valley ''Hearts and Arrows,'' musical by Phyllis Kirigin, presented by M and M Productions. April 1 at 2 p.m. Free. Finkelstein Memorial Library, 24 Chestnut Street. (845) 352-5700.
Tarrytown ''Evolution of Circus'' by Cirque America. Tuesday at 5 and 8 p.m. $25 to $45. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.

Armonk ''The Power of Color: The Power of the Brush,'' paintings by Joyce Wenglowski. Through April 15. Lecture by Gillian Greenhill Hannum, professor of art history at Manhattanville College: April 15 at 4 p.m.; $5, reservations required. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.
Beacon ''New Boots and Panties,'' portraits by Kit Keith. Through April 1. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Go North: A Space for Contemporary Art, 469 Main Street.

Beacon ''Models on Main Street,'' photography group show. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Muddy Cup Coffee House, 129 Main Street. (845) 440-8855.
Beacon Mixed-media group show, featuring works by Stevan Jennis, Molly Rausch and Simon Draper. Through Monday. Hours: daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Van Brunt Gallery, 460 Main Street. (845) 838-2995.
Bronx ''Sly,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. $5. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.
Bronx ''The Orchid Show,'' exhibition and sale. Through April 8. $5 to $20. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. Reception: April 15, 1 to 4:30 p.m. $2 to $4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.
Bronxville ''A Celebration of Childhood,'' watercolors by Miriam Schulman. Monday through April 29. Reception: April 29, 1 to 3 p.m. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.
Hudson ''View Three,'' works by three American Indian artists. Through April 7. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, noon to 6 p.m. Nicole Fiacco Gallery, 506 Warren Street. (518) 828-5090.

Katonah ''Tools as Art: The Hechinger Collection,'' curated by Sarah Tanguy. Through April 8. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Mount Vernon ''Overlooked Hero: John Glover and the American Revolution,'' historical documents and prints; continuing. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

New Paltz ''From Impressionist to Modernist: The Paintings of Woodstock Artist Charles Rosen.'' Through May 20. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Samuel Dorsky Museum of Art, SUNY New Paltz. (845) 257-3844.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibition. April 1 through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.
Peekskill ''First Look II,'' mixed media exhibition by art students. Through Sept. 30. $1 and $5. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 11 a.m.
to 6 p.m.; group tours available by appointment. Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art, 1701 Main Street. (914) 788-7166.

Pelham ''Lovely Dark and Deep: Women Artists Retake the Fairy Tale,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.

Port Chester ''East West Fusion,'' recent works by five member artists, with ''Joys of Raku,'' group show. April 1 through 28. Reception: April 1, 3 to 5 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.

Purchase ''New Media: When,'' group show. Through May 20. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. Through June 3. ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. $3 to $5. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through June 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.

Tivoli ''The Body Eclectic,'' mixed-media group show. Friday through April 29. Reception: April 7, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.
Valhalla ''Recurrents,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

West Nyack ''A Sequence of Steps,'' photography by Elizabeth Knowles. ''Jiffy Pop,'' mixed-media group show. Both through April 29. Artist panel and cocktail party: April 14 at 8 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockland Center for the Arts, 27 South Greenbush Road. (845) 358-0877.
